title: Vallejo: One dead, three injured including 9-year-old in shooting
content:
VALLEJO — A shooting Friday afternoon left one dead and three injured, including a child, officials said.
Vallejo police responded around 3:45 p.m. to reports of a shooting on the 500 block of Porter Street.
Neighbors told the Times-Herald they heard about 15 shots in rapid succession come from the street outside the line of houses.
Three men dressed in all black were seen fleeing the area in a burgundy or red Hyundai Sonata following the shooting, witnesses said. Details were unclear as of 5 p.m. Friday, but some shots may have been fired at the vehicle as it left.
When officers arrived, a man was found unresponsive in a car.
Barks from a neighbor’s dog filled the air as police quickly blocked off the roads leading to Porter Street with their vehicles and surrounded the area with crime tape.
A man and a woman were seen being removed from a nearby house on stretchers and were loaded into ambulances.
The extent of their injuries were not immediately available. The fourth victim, a 9-year-old, was apparently grazed in the face by a bullet.
More than a dozen evidence markers were seen dotting the street outside the residence.
Paramedics confirmed at least one fatality at the scene at 4:18 p.m. and said three people were transported to trauma centers.
As police vehicles began leaving the scene, a group of two women and four small children were ushered out of the house and said they were headed to the police department for questioning. Further details were unavailable at the time.
Matthew Adkins can be reached at 707-553-6833. Bay City News contributed to this report.
By Matthew Adkins
madkins@timesheraldonline.com
